Exception occured while code generation the wsdl
    java.lang.NullPointerException

Exception occured while code generation the wsdl
    java.lang.NullPointerException
    at org.eclipse.jst.ws.axis2.consumption.core.utils.WSDL2JavaGenerator.getAxisService(WSDL2JavaGenerator.java:366)

Created an attachment (id=61128)
fix for the bug

will fix the bug.
But the created client was added to another web project with Client suffix 
Is this a feature or we need to get this out and generate to same project?

The idea of the current framework is the Web service is generated into the current selected project, say "ProjectX", and the client is, by default, generated into another project, "ProjectXClient".  This is so to prevent the situation where the generated client files overwriting the service files if the client project is the same as the service project.  I'll give this patch a try a little bit later on.  Thanks!

With attachment 62215, the original problem with creating Axis2 bottom-up Web service with client is gone.  However, I still run into the problem described in comment #3, namely, the original WSDL used to create the skeleton is passed to the client side rather than the newly generated WSDL representing the correct endpoint of the skeleton Web service.
Also, the correct WSDL uri representing the newly deployed Axis2 Web service is not passed to the WSE.

Setting target to RC0 since these scenarios are main path scenarios:

1. Invoke WSE with correct URL for WSDL when setting service slider to TEST.

2. Skeleton scenario with client.

fix for the bug 175030

This patch also include a Refactoring of BUServiceContext to ServiceContext. 

Verified and tested. Please review and commit. This was timed as RC0

Thanks 

Lahiru
